item.title: About
item.description:
Test

Most users are familiar with purchasing crypto through a centralized exchange (CEX) like Coinbase or Binance. CEXes allow you to buy crypto with a debit card and off-ramp back to fiat (cash) when needed.

To interact with DeFi, however, you’ll need a non-custodial wallet. Unlike a CEX account, a non-custodial wallet gives you full control of your funds and lets you connect directly to dApps (decentralized apps). Currently, wallets allow you to buy crypto with a bank account, however, they lack offramp capabilities (converting crypto back to cash).
